title: Key terms
text: following terms used CVDPrevent API describe key concepts:

title: Key terms
text: can use cvd_time_period_system_levels() explore system levels reported time period. levels may vary time due changes NHS geography - example, Sustainability Transformation Partnerships (STPs) later replaced Integrated Care Systems (ICS / ICBs).1 following code snippet creates table showing system levels available reporting time period. ✔️ indicates data system level available corresponding period. : Selects relevant columns: Time period system level names Adds marker: check-mark indicate presence Reshapes data: Converts long format wide, system levels columns Displays result: Uses {gt} render clean, readable table
code: cvd_time_period_system_levels() |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c(     "TimePeriodID",     "TimePeriodName",     "SystemLevelName"   ))) |>   dplyr::mutate(value_show = "✔️") |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(     names_from = dplyr::any_of("SystemLevelName"),     values_from = dplyr::any_of("value_show"),     values_fill = ""   ) |>   gt::gt() |>   gt::tab_options(quarto.disable_processing = TRUE) |>   gt::cols_align(     align = "center",     columns = c(       dplyr::everything(),       -dplyr::any_of(c("TimePeriodName"))     )   )

title: Key terms
text: working areas, first step identify time period interested . important : areas can change time. example, area reported time period 1 may longer exist time period 21 (STP table). certain system levels excluded specific reports. instance, annual report covering Jan 2022 - Dec 2022 (time period id = 11) include PCN, Practice Sub-ICB level data. explore available areas, recommended function [cvd_area_list]. requires specify time period either system_level_id parent_area_id. Using system_level_id return areas within chosen time_period_id share system level. example, list NHS Regions (system_level_id = 6) available time period 22: Alternatively, already know area ’re interested , can use [cvd_area_search]. function searches partial area name returns matches specified time period. example, find areas containing word “acorn” time period 22:
code: cvd_area_list(time_period_id = 22, system_level_id = 6) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c(     "SystemLevelID",     "SystemLevelName",     "AreaName"   ))) |>   gt::gt() |>   gt::tab_options(quarto.disable_processing = TRUE) cvd_area_search(partial_area_name = "acorn", time_period_id = 22) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("AreaID", "AreaName"))) |>   gt::gt() |>   gt::tab_options(quarto.disable_processing = TRUE)

title: Key terms
text: working indicators, first need identify tthe time period system level interest. important indicators available every system level. example, indicators reported PCN Practice levels. following example dmonstrates list indicators available system level time period 26. : Retrieve system levels time periods Filter system levels avialable time period 26 system level, collect list indicators Pivot results table clearly shows indicators available system level resulting table provides quick overview indicator coverage across system levels, making easy spot gaps exist.
code: # get details for system levels and time periods syst_levels <- cvd_area_system_level_time_periods()  # get a summary of system level ids and names df_syst_levels <-   syst_levels |>   dplyr::filter(TimePeriodID == 26) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("SystemLevelID", "SystemLevelName")))  # iterate over all system levels available at time period id 26 and gather the indicators df_indicators_syst_level <-   purrr::map2_df(     .x = df_syst_levels$SystemLevelID,     .y = df_syst_levels$SystemLevelName,     .f = \(.x, .y) {       cvd_indicator_list(time_period_id = 26, system_level_id = .x) |>         dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("IndicatorID", "IndicatorShortName"))) |>         dplyr::mutate(SystemLevelName = .y)     }   )  # pivot the table to list system level df_indicators_syst_level |>   dplyr::mutate(value_show = "✔️") |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(     names_from = dplyr::any_of("SystemLevelName"),     values_from = dplyr::any_of("value_show"),     values_fill = ""   ) |>   gt::gt() |>   gt::tab_options(quarto.disable_processing = TRUE) |>   gt::cols_align(     align = "center",     columns = c(       gt::everything(),       -gt::any_of(c("IndicatorShortName"))     )   ) |>   gt::tab_header(     title = gt::md("Indicators for *Time Period 26* by system level")   )

title: Key terms
text: Metrics provide breakdowns indicator performance demographic categories sex, age group ethnicity. allow explore indicator varies across different population subgroups. function [cvd_indicator_metric_list] retrieves metrics indicators within specified time period system level. example shows list metrics available fro indicator AF: Prevalence (CVDP01AF) (Indicator ID = 1) time period 26 England system level: Understanding Metric Categories Common categories include: Age group Deprivation quintile Sex Age-standardised metrics: indicators, age-standardised versions categories also available. Sex disaggregation: certain metrics broken sex. example, table , age group 18-39 reported persons group (CategoryAttribute = Person) separately Male Female subgroups.
code: cvd_indicator_metric_list(time_period_id = 26, system_level_id = 1) |>   dplyr::filter(IndicatorID == 1) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c(     "MetricCategoryTypeName",     "Indicator",     "MetricCategoryName",     "CategoryAttribute",     "MetricID"   ))) |>   dplyr::group_by(MetricCategoryTypeName) |>   dplyr::arrange(MetricCategoryName, .by_group = TRUE) |>   gt::gt(row_group_as_column = TRUE) |>   gt::tab_options(quarto.disable_processing = TRUE) |>   gt::tab_stubhead(label = "MetricCategoryTypeName") |>   gt::tab_header(     title = gt::md(       "**Metrics** for *Indicator 1 (AF: Prevalence)* in *Time Period 26* and for the *England* system level"     )   )

title: Key terms
text: Together, terms form foundation CVDPrevent API provide consistent language working cardiovascular data. clearly defining system levels, areas, time periods, indicators metrics API enables users navigate complex dataset confidence, compare performance across different contexts explore meaningful demographic breakdowns. Understanding concepts essential first step making use wider functionality demonstrated vignette.

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: CVD Prevent audit publishes data approximately four times per year. view four recent reporting periods standard indicators, use cvd_time_period_list() function: two main types indicator reported: - “Standard” (IndicatorTypeID = 1) “Outcomes” (IndicatorTypeID = 2) retrieve time periods specific indicator type, pass relevant ID optional indicator_type_id parameter:
code: cvd_time_period_list() |>   dplyr::filter(IndicatorTypeName == 'Standard') |>   dplyr::slice_max(order_by = TimePeriodID, n = 4) |>   dplyr::select(TimePeriodID, TimePeriodName) |>   gt::gt() cvd_time_period_list(indicator_type_id = 2) |>   dplyr::slice_max(order_by = TimePeriodID, n = 4) |>   dplyr::select(     IndicatorTypeID,     IndicatorTypeName,     TimePeriodID,     TimePeriodName   ) |>   gt::gt()

what: Listing system levels by time period
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Audit data reported across multiple geographic levels (referred System Levels), ranging individual GP practices national-level aggregates (e.g., England). view system levels available time period, use cvd_time_period_system_levels() function:
code: cvd_time_period_system_levels() |>   dplyr::slice_max(order_by = TimePeriodID) |>   dplyr::select(TimePeriodID, TimePeriodName, SystemLevelID, SystemLevelName) |>   gt::gt()

what: List available system levels for a given time period
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: find system levels reported specific time period can use cvd_area_system_level() function, providing required time_period_id, (NB, time_period_id defaults first time period supplied).
code: cvd_area_system_level(time_period_id = 17) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelID, SystemLevelName) |>   gt::gt()

what: List all available reporting periods for each system level
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Use cvd_area_system_level_time_periods() function show list reporting periods system level. show latest four reporting periods GP practice system level.
code: cvd_area_system_level_time_periods() |>   dplyr::filter(SystemLevelName == 'Practice') |>   dplyr::slice_max(order_by = TimePeriodID, n = 4) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelID, SystemLevelName, TimePeriodID, TimePeriodName) |>   gt::gt()

what: List areas for a time period and system level or parent area
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: list four Primary Care Networks (PCN) (SystemLevelID = 4) data available time period 17 use cvd_area_list() function. Either parent area system level must specified.
code: cvd_area_list(time_period_id = 17, system_level_id = 4) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelName, AreaID, AreaCode, AreaName) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>   gt::gt()

what: View details for a specific area
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: view details specific area use cvd_area_details() required parameters ‘time_period_id’ ‘area_id’. return function list three named tibbles: area_details, area_child_details (appropriate), area_parent_details (appropriate). tibbles first need extracting returned list object, done using list$object notation. view area details: View details parent area: View details children area:
code: # get the list from the function returned_list <- cvd_area_details(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 7922) returned_list$area_details |>   dplyr::select(AreaCode, AreaName, SystemLevelID) |>   gt::gt() returned_list$area_parent_details |>   dplyr::select(AreaID, AreaName, SystemLevelID) |>   gt::gt() returned_list$area_child_details |>   dplyr::select(AreaID, AreaName, SystemLevelID) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: areas parent details data reported given period, may mean missed searching areas. function provides convenient way accessing details given ‘time_period_id’ ‘system_level_id’. report four GP practices without parent PCN: top system_level (England) parent either:
code: cvd_area_unassigned(time_period_id = 17, system_level_id = 5) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelName, AreaID, AreaName) |>   gt::gt() cvd_area_unassigned(time_period_id = 17, system_level_id = 1) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelName, AreaID, AreaName) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: find details area don’t know ID number can perform partial name search using cvd_area_search() specify time period search.
code: cvd_area_search(partial_area_name = 'foo', time_period_id = 17) |>   dplyr::select(AreaID, AreaName, AreaCode) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: retrieve details specific area, including nested system areas within , can use function cvd_area_nested_subsystems(). function requires area_id input. example , request details Greater Manchester ICB (area_id = 8030), returns named list tibbles representing heirarchical levels: tibble level_1 provides details requested area . can view using: next level, level_2, contains areas direct children requested area. , display hte first four entries: Subsequent levels (level_3, level_4, etc.) represent nested areas - children children - can explored way.
code: return_list <- cvd_area_nested_subsystems(area_id = 8030) return_list |> summary() #>         Length Class  Mode #> level_1 7      tbl_df list #> level_2 7      tbl_df list #> level_3 7      tbl_df list #> level_4 7      tbl_df list return_list$level_1 |>   gt::gt() return_list$level_2 |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Indicator represents cardiovascular disease health indicator defined NHS England. example Indicator CVDP001AF, ‘Prevalence GP recorded atrial fibrillation patients aged 18 ’. Indicators unique Indicator IDs. indicator broken Metrics. Metric represents breakdown indicator inequality markers. example inequality marker ‘Age Group - Male, 40-59’. Metrics unique Metric IDs representing combination Indicator Metric Category. Metric Category describes inequality markers Metric applies . Metric Category unique ID combination Name Metric Category Type. Metric Category belongs Metric Category Type groups Metric Categories one entity. Metric Category Type unique ID. example, ‘Male - 40-59’ Metric Category ‘Age Group’ Metric Category Type. Age Group also contain categories ‘18-39’, ‘40-59’, ‘60-79’, ‘80+’. Assigning Metric Categories Metric Category Type allows comparison metrics one inequality marker (case Age Group), displaying Metric Categories Metric Category Type alongside .

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: get list available indicators given time period system level can use cvd_indicator_list() function specify time period system level interested . access first four indicators time point 17 GP practice level (system level 5).
code: cvd_indicator_list(time_period_id = 17, system_level_id = 5) |>   dplyr::select(IndicatorID, IndicatorCode, IndicatorShortName) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: list metrics indicator can use cvd_indicator_metric_list() function specify time period system level interested . access metrics prevalence atrial fibrillation (Indicator ID 1) focussing just metrics available 40-59 years age group:
code: cvd_indicator_metric_list(time_period_id = 17, system_level_id = 1) |>   dplyr::filter(IndicatorID == 1, MetricCategoryName == '40-59') |>   dplyr::count(     IndicatorID,     IndicatorShortName,     MetricID,     MetricCategoryName,     CategoryAttribute   ) |>   dplyr::select(-n) |>   gt::gt()

what: List all indicator data for a given area
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: access indicator data given area time period can use cvd_indicator() function. return API includes four sets data grouped together four tibbles within named list object. four tibbles include: indicators, metric categories, metric data, time-series data, look ‘3 Centres PCN’ (area ID 1103) time period 17:
code: returned_list <- cvd_indicator(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 1103) returned_list |> summary() #>                   Length Class  Mode #> indicators        14     tbl_df list #> metric_categories  7     tbl_df list #> metric_data       19     tbl_df list #> timeseries_data    7     tbl_df list

code: returned_list$indicators |>   dplyr::select(IndicatorID, IndicatorCode, IndicatorShortName) |>   dplyr::arrange(IndicatorID) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: set time-series data area also supplied returned metrics, provide results available time periods. data accessible timeseries_data object. show time-series two categories metric shown plot.
code: returned_list$timeseries_data |>   dplyr::filter(MetricID %in% c(126, 132), !is.na(Value)) |>   # prepare for plotting   dplyr::mutate(     EndDate = as.Date(EndDate, format = '%a, %d %b %Y 00:00:00 GMT'),     MetricID = MetricID |> as.factor()   ) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(     x = EndDate,     y = Value,     group = MetricID,     colour = MetricID   )) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::geom_line()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Indicators searchable one Tag, supplied optional argument tag_id. Tag ID can single ID number vector IDs, shown vector IDs 12 13 (hypertension blood pressure measures). See also List indicator tags.
code: returned_list <-   cvd_indicator(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 3, tag_id = c(3, 4)) if (!is.null(returned_list$indicators)) {   returned_list$indicators |>     dplyr::select(IndicatorID, IndicatorCode, IndicatorShortName) |>     dplyr::arrange(IndicatorID) |>     dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) |>     gt::gt() }

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Indicators one tags can used filter related indicators. get list tags can use cvd_indicator_tags() function
code: cvd_indicator_tags() |>   dplyr::arrange(IndicatorTagID) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: get details meta-data specific indicator, use cvd_indicator_details() function, specifying indicator ID interest. Meta-data includes details copyright information, source data, definitions method calculating confidence intervals.
code: cvd_indicator_details(indicator_id = 7) |>   dplyr::select(IndicatorID, MetaDataTitle, MetaData) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: find performance sibling areas (areas share common parent area, GP practices within PCN PCNs within ICB), can use cvd_indicator_sibling() function, specifying time period, area metric. get data Metric 126 (relating indicator 2- Hypertension treatment) siblings ‘3 Centres PCN’ (ID 1103):
code: cvd_indicator_sibling(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 1103, metric_id = 126) |>   dplyr::select(     AreaID,     AreaName,     Value,     LowerConfidenceLimit,     UpperConfidenceLimit   ) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: find performance child areas (areas organisationally one level lower specified area), can use cvd_indicator_child_data() function, specifying time period, area metric. get data Metric 126 (relating indicator 17 - Hypertension treatment) children ‘NHS Shropshire, Telford Wrekin CCG’ (ID 126):
code: cvd_indicator_child_data(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 74, metric_id = 126) |>   dplyr::select(     AreaID,     AreaName,     Value,     LowerConfidenceLimit,     UpperConfidenceLimit   ) |>   gt::gt()

what: All metric data for a given time, area and indicator
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: access metric data given area, time period indicator can use cvd_indicator_data() function. return API includes three sets data grouped together three tibbles within named list object. three tibbles include: indicator metrics, area data, national data, look ‘AF: treatment anticoagulants’ (indicator ID 7) time period 17 ‘Leicester Central PCN’ (area_id 701) focussed metrics gender:
code: returned_list <- cvd_indicator_data(   time_period_id = 17,   indicator_id = 7,   area_id = 701 ) returned_list |> summary() #>                   Length Class  Mode #> indicator_metrics 17     tbl_df list #> area_data         27     tbl_df list #> national_data     26     tbl_df list

what: Benchmark metric data with national results
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: return metric data given area time period along national results compare use function cvd_indicator_nationalarea_metric_data(). output list named tibbles. two possible tibbles : area: contains metric data specified area comparison national metric data. target: contains details reach target values, including: target value percentage (stored whole number 100) target patients (number additional patients needed reach target percentage) Note target tibble provided data available national chosen area. compare performance metric 150 (AF: treatment anticoagulants - people) ‘Chester South PCN’ (area ID 553) national performance:
code: returned_list <- cvd_indicator_nationalarea_metric_data(   metric_id = 150,   time_period_id = 17,   area_id = 553 )  returned_list |> summary() #>        Length Class  Mode #> area   7      tbl_df list #> target 3      tbl_df list

what: Return time series data for a metric and area
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: get data available time points given metric use cvd_indicator_metric_timeseries() function whilst specifying area ID. visualise data Salford South East PCN (area ID 705) ‘AF: treatment anticoagulants’ women people aged 60-79 years (metric ID 130):  can view details time-series performance metric:
code: cvd_indicator_metric_timeseries(metric_id = 130, area_id = 705) |>   # prepare for plotting   dplyr::mutate(     TimePeriodName = stats::reorder(TimePeriodName, TimePeriodID)   ) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(     x = TimePeriodName,     y = Value,     group = AreaName,     colour = AreaName   )) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::geom_line() +   ggplot2::theme(     axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)   ) cvd_indicator_metric_timeseries(metric_id = 130, area_id = 705) |>   dplyr::select(AreaName, TimePeriodName, TimePeriodID, Value) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(     names_from = AreaName,     values_from = Value   ) |>   gt::gt()

what: Return time series data for an indicator and area - inequalities
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: see time series data metric breakdowns indicator use cvd_indicator_person_timeseries() function along indicator ID specify area. view time-series metric data indicator ‘AF: treatment anticoagulants’ (ID 7) Salford South East PCN (area ID 705), focussed just age group inequalities metrics:  can view details time-series performance metrics:
code: cvd_indicator_person_timeseries(indicator_id = 7, area_id = 705) |>   dplyr::filter(     MetricCategoryTypeName == 'Age group',     !is.na(Value)   ) |>   dplyr::mutate(     TimePeriodName = stats::reorder(TimePeriodName, TimePeriodID)   ) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(     ggplot2::aes(       x = TimePeriodName,       y = Value,       group = MetricCategoryName,       colour = MetricCategoryName     )   ) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::geom_line() +   ggplot2::theme(     axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)   ) cvd_indicator_person_timeseries(indicator_id = 7, area_id = 705) |>   dplyr::filter(     MetricCategoryTypeName == 'Age group',     !is.na(Value)   ) |>   dplyr::select(MetricCategoryName, TimePeriodName, TimePeriodID, Value) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(     names_from = MetricCategoryName,     values_from = Value   ) |>   gt::gt()

what: Return system level comparisons for a metric
title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Use cvd_indicator_metric_systemlevel_comparison() function return metric performance specified time period organisations system level, example GP practices PCNs. return performance metric ‘AF: DOAC & VitK’ people aged 40-59 years (metric ID 1270) time period 17 Salford South East PCN (area ID 705) PCNs - truncated sample four PCN performances:
code: cvd_indicator_metric_systemlevel_comparison(   metric_id = 1270,   time_period_id = 17,   area_id = 705 ) |>   dplyr::filter(AreaID %in% c(705:709), !is.na(Value)) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelName, AreaID, AreaName, Value) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: Use cvd_indicator_metric_area_breakdown() function return data Area Breakdown chart. return performance metric ‘AF: DOAC & VitK’ men aged 60-79 years (metric ID 128) time period 17 Salford South East PCN (area ID 705):
code: cvd_indicator_metric_area_breakdown(   metric_id = 128,   time_period_id = 17,   area_id = 705 ) |>   dplyr::select(SystemLevelName, AreaID, AreaName, Value) |>   gt::gt()

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: return list external resources used API use function cvd_external_resource(). show first five external resources:
code: cvd_external_resource() |>   dplyr::filter(ExternalResourceID < 10) |>   dplyr::select(     ExternalResourceCategory,     ExternalResourceSource,     ExternalResourceTitle   ) |>   dplyr::group_by(ExternalResourceCategory) |>   gt::gt(row_group_as_column = T)

title: Using CVD Prevent
text: show data availability given system level given time period use cvd_data_availability() function. NB, data appears available time period 6 (September 2022).
code: cvd_data_availability(time_period_id = 6, system_level_id = 5) |>   dplyr::select(     IndicatorShortName,     IsAvailable,     SystemLevelName,     MetricCategoryTypeID   ) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) |>   gt::gt()

what: Access and Analyse Data from the CVD Prevent API
title: Access and Analyse Data from the CVD Prevent API
text: CVD Prevent R package provides user-friendly interface NHS CVDPREVENT API. enables analysts, researchers healthcare professionals access work England-wide primary care cardiovascular disease (CVD) audit data directly R. Cardiovascular Disease Prevention Audit (CVDPREVENT) automatically extracts routinely held GP data. Data & Improvement Tool provides open access data, clear, actionable insights tasked improving cardiovascular health.

title: Access and Analyse Data from the CVD Prevent API
text: Simple R functions make API requests retrieve CVD indicator area data Tidyverse-friendly outputs (mostly tibbles) Support listing indicators, metrics, time periods, areas Helper functions searching exploring heirarchical NHS area structures See full API documentation endpoints reference

title: Access and Analyse Data from the CVD Prevent API
text: can install latest development version GitHub : install latest stable release CRAN:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("craig-parylo/cvdprevent") pak::pak("cvdprevent")

title: Access and Analyse Data from the CVD Prevent API
text: Typical outputs tibbles, making easy filter manipulate: See package vignette examples guidance:
code: library(cvdprevent)  # List all available indicators (first 4 shown) cvd_indicator_list(time_period_id = 22, system_level_id = 1) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c(     "IndicatorID",     "IndicatorCode",     "IndicatorShortName"   ))) |>   dplyr::slice_head(n = 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   IndicatorID IndicatorCode IndicatorShortName                                   #>         <int> <chr>         <chr>                                                #> 1           1 CVDP001AF     AF: Prevalence (CVDP001AF)                           #> 2           2 CVDP002HYP    Hypertension: Treated to appropriate threshold (age… #> 3           3 CVDP003HYP    Hypertension: Treated to appropriate threshold (age… #> 4           4 CVDP004HYP    Hypertension: BP monitoring (CVDP004HYP) # List the latest four time periods for 'Standard' indicators cvd_time_period_list() |>   dplyr::filter(IndicatorTypeName == "Standard") |>   dplyr::slice_max(order_by = TimePeriodID, n = 4) |>   dplyr::select(TimePeriodID, TimePeriodName) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   TimePeriodID TimePeriodName    #>          <int> <chr>             #> 1           26 To June 2025      #> 2           24 To March 2025     #> 3           22 To December 2024  #> 4           20 To September 2024 vignette("using_cvdprevent", package = "cvdprevent")

what: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: Returns detailed information single NHS area given reporting period, including details, well parent child areas. allows understand heirarchical context (e.g., parent ICB, child PCNs Practices) specified area.

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
code: cvd_area_details(time_period_id, area_id)

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: time_period_id Integer (required). reporting period area details returned. Use cvd_time_period_list() find valid IDs. area_id Integer (required). AreaID return details . Use cvd_area_list() cvd_area_search() find valid IDs.

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: named list three tibbles: area_details tibble details specified area. area_parent_details tibble details parent area(s), available. area_child_details tibble details child area(s), available. data found, returns tibble describing error. area_details, area_parent_details area_child_details typically contain following columns: AreaCode Character. ONS internal code NHS area (e.g., "E54000015"). AreaID Integer. Unique identifier NHS area. AreaName Character. Full name NHS area (e.g., "NHS Leicester, Leicestershire Rutland Integrated Care Board"). AreaOdsCode Character. ODS (Organisation Data Service) code area (e.g., "QK1"). SystemLevelID Integer. Unique identifier system level (e.g., 7 = ICB). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level (e.g., "ICB").

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: function useful navigating NHS area heirarchies, finding practices within PCN, determining parent ICB given area. result list tibbles, can extract work component separately.

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: function may take longer 5 seconds complete due API response time.

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
text: See CVDPREVENT API documentation: Area details

title: Retrieve details for a specific NHS area and time period — cvd_area_details
code: # \donttest{ # Retrieve details for 'Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland ICB' (area_id = 8037) # in time period 17 returned_list <- cvd_area_details(time_period_id = 17, area_id = 8037)  # View details for the area returned_list$area_details |> dplyr::select(AreaCode, AreaName) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   AreaCode  AreaName                                                        #>   <chr>     <chr>                                                           #> 1 E54000015 NHS Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland Integrated Care Board  # View details for the parent area(s) returned_list$area_parent_details |> dplyr::select(AreaID, AreaName, SystemLevelID) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   AreaID AreaName SystemLevelID #>    <int> <chr>            <int> #> 1   7922 Midlands             6  # View details for the child area(s) returned_list$area_child_details |> dplyr::select(AreaID, AreaName, SystemLevelID) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   AreaID AreaName                                            SystemLevelID #>    <int> <chr>                                                       <int> #> 1   7994 NHS Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland ICB - 03W             8 #> 2   8009 NHS Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland ICB - 04C             8 #> 3   8014 NHS Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland ICB - 04V             8 # }

what: Retieve flat sub-systems for an NHS area, grouped by system level — cvd_area_flat_subsystems
title: Retieve flat sub-systems for an NHS area, grouped by system level — cvd_area_flat_subsystems
text: Returns "flat" list specified NHS area immediate child areas CVDPREVENT API, child areas grouped system level rather strict heirarchical nesting. function provides convenient overview want see sub-areas organised level (e.g., PCNs GP practices beneath ICB) without traversing full heirarchy. output tibble row represents area sub-area, child areas included columns (system level information).

title: Retieve flat sub-systems for an NHS area, grouped by system level — cvd_area_flat_subsystems
code: cvd_area_flat_subsystems(area_id)

title: Retieve flat sub-systems for an NHS area, grouped by system level — cvd_area_flat_subsystems
text: area_id Integer (required). AreaID retrieve flat sub-system data. use cvd_area_list() cvd_area_search() find valid IDs.

title: Retieve flat sub-systems for an NHS area, grouped by system level — cvd_area_flat_subsystems
text: tibble containing details specified area child areas child area details (e.g., via SubSystems_* columns). Typical columns include: AreaCode Character. Code parent NHS area (e.g., "E54000038"). AreaID Integer. Unique identifier parent NHS area. AreaName Character. Name parent NHS area (e.g., "Somerset"). AreaOdsCode Character. ODS (Organisation Data Service) code parent area (e.g., "QSL"). ParentAreaID Integer. Identifier higher-level parent area (e.g., regional national grouping). SubSystems_AreaCode Character. Code subsystem NHS area (e.g., practice PCN). SubSystems_AreaID Integer. Unique identifier subsystem NHS area. SubSystems_AreaName Character. Name subsystem NHS area (e.g., "Church Street Surgery, Martock"). SubSystems_AreaOdsCode Character. ODS code subsystem area, available. Often blank. SubSystems_ParentAreaID Integer. ID immediate parent area subsystem (e.g., PCN ICB). SubSystems_SystemLevelID Integer. Identifier system level subsystem (e.g., 5 = Practice, 4 = PCN). SubSystems_SystemLevelName Character. Name system level subsystem (e.g., "Practice", "PCN"). SystemLevelID Integer. Identifier system level parent area (e.g., 2 = STP). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level parent area (e.g., "STP"). data found, returns tibble describing error.

what: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
text: Retrieves NHS geographical areas (e.g., England, Region, ICB, PCN, Practice) data avialable specified reporting period either pareent area system level. areas data chosen time period returned. must specify least one parent_area_id system_level_id. provided, parent_area_id takes precedence system_level_id ignored. parent_area_id specified, returns child areas specified parent area. system_level_id specified, returns areas within system level.

title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
code: cvd_area_list(time_period_id, parent_area_id = NULL, system_level_id = NULL)

title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
text: time_period_id Integer (required). reporting period ID return areas. Use cvd_time_period_list() find valid IDs. parent_area_id Integer (optional). AreaID children returned. provided, takes precedence system_level_id. system_level_id Integer (optional). system level ID return areas (e.g., Practice, PCN, ICB). Ignored parent_area_id specified. Use cvd_area_system_level() find valid IDs given time period.

title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
text: tibble containing area details specified criteria following columns: AreaCode Character. ONS code NHS area (e.g., "U91471"). AreaID Integer. Unique identifier NHS area. AreaName Character. Name NHS area (e.g., "Inclusive Health PCN"). AreaOdsCode Character. ODS (Organisation Data Service) code area, available. Often blank. ParticipationRate Numeric. Percentage practices organisations participating CVDPREVENT program within area. PopulationRate Numeric. Percentage population covered participating organisations area. SystemLevelID Integer. Unique identifier system level (e.g., 4 = PCN). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level (e.g., "PCN"). Parents Integer. ID parent organisation grouping (e.g., ICB region). data found, returns tibble describing error.

title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list
text: least one parent_area_id system_level_id must supplied, otherwise error thrown. function commonly used list practices within given PCN, PCNs within ICB, areas specific system level chosen time period.

title: List NHS areas for a given time period and parent or system level — cvd_area_list

what: Retrieve nested sub-systems for an NHS area — cvd_area_nested_subsystems
title: Retrieve nested sub-systems for an NHS area — cvd_area_nested_subsystems
text: Returns hierarchical (nested) structure specified NHS area descendent (child) areas CVDPREVENT API. function useful exploring parent-child relationships within NHS geographies, seeing PCN practices, ICB subordinate structures. output list tibbles, one "level" heirarchy, named level_1, level_2, etc. tibble contains details areas level.

title: Retrieve nested sub-systems for an NHS area — cvd_area_nested_subsystems
code: cvd_area_nested_subsystems(area_id)

title: Retrieve nested sub-systems for an NHS area — cvd_area_nested_subsystems
text: area_id Integer (required). AreaID retrieve nested sub-system data. Use cvd_area_list() cvd_area_search() find valid IDs.

title: Retrieve nested sub-systems for an NHS area — cvd_area_nested_subsystems
text: named list tibbles, element (level_1, level_2, etc.) contains details specified area subsequent child level. data found, returns tibble describing error. tibble contains following columns: AreaCode Character. Unique code NHS area (e.g., "U11103"). AreaID Integer. Unique identifier NHS area. AreaName Character. Name NHS area (e.g., "Yeovil PCN"). AreaOdsCode Character. ODS (Organisation Data Service) code area, available. Often blank. ParentAreaID Integer. ID parent NHS area organisation (e.g., ICB region). SystemLevelID Integer. Identifier system level (e.g., 4 = PCN). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level (e.g., "PCN").

what: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
text: Searches NHS areas whose names match given partial string, within specified reporting time period. function uses case-insensitive "LIKE" search (.e., matches area containing search term) returns areas data available specified period.

title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
code: cvd_area_search(partial_area_name, time_period_id)

title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
text: partial_area_name String (required). substring search within area names (case-insensitive). may part area name, e.g., "practice", "PCN", specific place. time_period_id Integer (required). reporting period (time period) restrict search areas data. use cvd_time_period_list() obtain valid IDs.

title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
text: tibble containing details areas matching search term data specified time period. Typical columns include: AreaCode Character. Unique code NHS area (e.g., "P86619"). AreaID Integer. Unique identifier NHS area AreaName Character. Name NHS area (e.g., "Dr Mb Ghafoor & Partners"). IsVisible Logical character. Indicates whether area visible API dashboard ("Y" "N"). NationalLevel Logical character. Indicates whether area included national-level aggregations ("Y" "N"). OdsCode Character. ODS (Organisation Data Service) code area, available. Often blank. SystemLevelID Integer. Identifier system level (5 = GP Practices). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level (e.g., "Practice"). SystemLevelOrder Integer. Display order system level dashboards reports. data found, returns tibble describing error.

title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
text: search case-insensitive matches anywhere area name. areas available data chosen time period returned. Use function quickly locate AreaIDs codes use cvdprevent API calls.

title: Search for NHS areas by partial name and time period — cvd_area_search
text: function may take longer 5 seconds complete due API response time.

what: Retrieve all indicators and their data for a given time period and area — cvd_indicator
title: Retrieve all indicators and their data for a given time period and area — cvd_indicator
text: Returns CVD indicators related data specified reporting period (time_period_id) NHS area (area_id) CVDPREVENT API. Also retrieves time series data available periods. Optionally, can filter results one indicator tags. returned object named list tibbles, including details indicators, metric categories, metric data time series, making function ideal comprehensive data extraction downstream analysis.

title: Retrieve all indicators and their data for a given time period and area — cvd_indicator
code: cvd_indicator(time_period_id, area_id, tag_id = NULL)

title: Retrieve all indicators and their data for a given time period and area — cvd_indicator
text: time_period_id Integer (required). reporting period (time period) return indicator data. Use cvd_time_period_list() find valid IDs. area_id Integer (required). AreaID return indicator data. Use cvd_area_list() cvd_area_search() find valid IDs. tag_id Numeric vector (optional). One tag IDs filter indicators tag. Use cvd_indicator_tags() find valid IDs.

title: Retrieve all indicators and their data for a given time period and area — cvd_indicator
text: named list containing four tibbles: indicators Tibble indicators area time period. metric_categories Tibble metric categories related indicators. metric_data Tibble metric values area indicators. timeseries_data Tibble time series data metrics indicators across time periods. indicators found, returns tibble describing error. indicators contains following columns: AxisCharacter Character. Symbol used represent metric axis (e.g., "%"). DataUpdateInterval Character. Frequency interval indicator data updated. Often blank. FormatDisplayName Character. Display format metric (e.g., "Proportion %"). HighestPriorityNotificationType Character. Notification priority level, applicable (e.g., "Red"). Often blank. IndicatorCode Character. Unique code indicator (e.g., "CVDP009CHOL"). IndicatorFormatID Integer. Internal ID indicator's format type. IndicatorID Integer. Unique identifier indicator. IndicatorName Character. Full descriptive name indicator. IndicatorOrder Integer. Display order indicator dashboards reports. IndicatorShortName Character. Abbreviated name indicator display purposes. IndicatorStatus Character. Status indicator (e.g., active, discontinued). Often blank. IndicatorTypeID Integer. Unique identifier indicator type (e.g., 1 = Standard). IndicatorTypeName Character. Name indicator type (e.g., "Standard"). NotificationCount Integer. Count notifications associated indicator. metric_categories contains following columns: IndicatorID Integer. Unique identifier indicator. Links corresponding entry indicators table. CategoryAttribute Character. Grouping label used define population subset (e.g., "Male", "Persons"). MetricCategoryID Integer. Unique identifier metric category. MetricCategoryName Character. Name subgroup category (e.g., "80+", "Mixed", "Female"). MetricCategoryOrder Integer. Display order category within type. MetricCategoryTypeName Character. Type category used breakdown (e.g., "Age group", "Sex", "Ethnicity"). MetricID Integer. Unique identifier specific metric instance. metric_data contains following columns: MetricID Integer. Unique identifier metric instance. Links corresponding entry metric categories table. AreaID Integer. Unique identifier NHS area. Count Integer. Number records included calculation. DataID Integer. Unique identifier data point. Denominator Numeric. Denominator used metric calculation. Factor Numeric. Scaling factor applied metric, applicable. Often blank. LowerConfidenceLimit Numeric. Lower bound confidence interval. Max Numeric. Maximum observed value metric. Median Numeric. Median value metric. Min Numeric. Minimum observed value metric. Numerator Numeric. Numerator used metric calculation. Q20 Numeric. 20th percentile value. Q40 Numeric. 40th percentile value. Q60 Numeric. 60th percentile value. Q80 Numeric. 80th percentile value. TimePeriodID Integer. Identifier time period associated metric. UpperConfidenceLimit Numeric. Upper bound confidence interval. Value Numeric. Final calculated value metric. ValueNote Character. Notes flags associated value (e.g., suppression warnings). timeseries_data contains following columns: MetricID Integer. Unique identifier metric instance. Links corresponding entry metric data table. EndDate POSIXct. End date reporting period (e.g., "2025-06-30"). Median Numeric. Median value metric specified time period. StartDate POSIXct. Start date reporting period. Typically set default baseline (e.g., "1900-01-01"). TimePeriodID Integer. Unique identifier time period. TimePeriodName Character. Display label time period (e.g., "June 2025"). Value Numeric. Final calculated value metric given time period.

title: Retrieve CVD indicator data for a specific area and time period — cvd_indicator_data
text: Fetches available metric breakdowns single cardiovascular disease (CVD) indicator CVDPREVENT API, scoped specified NHS area reporting period. includes subgroup data age, sex, ethnicity, deprivation quintile, .

title: Retrieve CVD indicator data for a specific area and time period — cvd_indicator_data
code: cvd_indicator_data(time_period_id, area_id, indicator_id)

title: Retrieve CVD indicator data for a specific area and time period — cvd_indicator_data
text: time_period_id Integer (required). reporting period (time period) retrieve data . Use cvd_time_period_list() find valid IDs. area_id Integer (required). AreaID retrieve indicator data. use cvd_area_list() cvd_area_search() find valid IDs. indicator_id Integer (required). IndicatorID retrieve data. use cvd_indicator_list() cvd_indicator_metric_list() find valid IDs.

title: Retrieve CVD indicator data for a specific area and time period — cvd_indicator_data
text: named list containing three tibbles: indicator_metrics Tibble. Metadata definitions selected indicator associated metrics. area_data Tibble. Metric values specified NHS area (area_id) across available breakdowns. national_data Tibble. Metric values England, used benchmarking comparison. indicator data found, returns tibble describing error. indicator_metrics contains following items: AxisCharacter Character. Symbol used represent metric axis (e.g., "%"). FormatDisplayName Character. Display format metric (e.g., "Proportion %"). IndicatorCode Character. Unique code indicator (e.g., "CVDP002AF"). IndicatorFormatID Integer. Internal ID indicator's format type. IndicatorID Integer. Unique identifier indicator. IndicatorName Character. Full descriptive name indicator. IndicatorOrder Integer. Display order indicator dashboards reports. IndicatorShortName Character. Abbreviated name indicator display. NotificationCount Integer. Count notifications associated indicator. Often zero. TimePeriodID Integer. ID reporting time period. TimePeriodName Character. Label reporting time period (e.g., "March 2024"). CategoryAttribute Character. Subgroup label (e.g., "Male", "Female", "Persons"). MetricCategoryID Integer. Unique ID metric category. MetricCategoryName Character. Name subgroup category (e.g., "18–39", "Sex"). MetricCategoryOrder Integer. Display order metric category. MetricCategoryTypeName Character. Type subgroup (e.g., "Age group", "Sex"). MetricID Integer. Unique ID specific metric measured. area_data national_data contain following items: MetricID Integer. Unique identifier metric measured. MetricCategoryTypeName Character. Type subgroup (e.g., "Sex", "Age group"). MetricCategoryName Character. Name subgroup (e.g., "Female", "18–39"). CategoryAttribute Character. Label used group individuals (e.g., "Male", "Persons"). AreaCode Character. ONS code NHS area (e.g., "U60176"). AreaID Integer. Internal ID NHS area. AreaName Character. Name NHS area (e.g., "3 Centres PCN"). Count Integer. Total number individuals subgroup. DataID Integer. Unique identifier data record. Denominator Numeric. Population count used denominator metric calculation. Factor Numeric. Scaling factor applied metric, applicable. Often NA. HighestPriorityNotificationType Character. Notification priority level, available. Often NA. LowerConfidenceLimit Numeric. Lower bound confidence interval metric value. Max Numeric. Maximum observed value metric across comparable areas. Median Numeric. Median value metric across comparable areas. Min Numeric. Minimum observed value metric across comparable areas. NotificationCount Integer. Count notifications associated indicator. Often zero. Numerator Numeric. Count used numerator metric calculation. Q20 Numeric. 20th percentile value across comparable areas. Q40 Numeric. 40th percentile value across comparable areas. Q60 Numeric. 60th percentile value across comparable areas. Q80 Numeric. 80th percentile value across comparable areas. TimePeriodID Integer. ID reporting time period. TimePeriodName Character. Label reporting time period (e.g., "March 2024"). UpperConfidenceLimit Numeric. Upper bound confidence interval metric value. Value Numeric. Calculated metric value (e.g., percentage patients treated). ValueNote Character. Additional notes flags value. Often NA.

title: Retrieve metric data for a specific metric, time period and area — cvd_indicator_metric_data
text: named list containing three tibbles: metrics Tibble. Metadata definitions selected metric. area_data Tibble. Metric values specified NHS area (area_id). national_data Tibble. Metric values England, used benchmarking comparison. indicator data found, returns tibble describing error. indicator_metrics contains following items: AxisCharacter Character. Symbol used represent metric axis (e.g., "%"). FormatDisplayName Character. Display format metric (e.g., "Proportion %"). IndicatorCode Character. Unique code indicator (e.g., "CVDP002AF"). IndicatorFormatID Integer. Internal ID indicator's format type. IndicatorID Integer. Unique identifier indicator. IndicatorName Character. Full descriptive name indicator. IndicatorOrder Integer. Display order indicator dashboards reports. IndicatorShortName Character. Abbreviated name indicator display. NotificationCount Integer. Count notifications associated indicator. Often zero. TimePeriodID Integer. ID reporting time period. TimePeriodName Character. Label reporting time period (e.g., "March 2024"). CategoryAttribute Character. Subgroup label (e.g., "Male", "Female", "Persons"). MetricCategoryID Integer. Unique ID metric category. MetricCategoryName Character. Name subgroup category (e.g., "18–39", "Sex"). MetricCategoryOrder Integer. Display order metric category. MetricCategoryTypeName Character. Type subgroup (e.g., "Age group", "Sex"). MetricID Integer. Unique ID specific metric measured. area_data national_data contain following items: MetricID Integer. Unique identifier metric measured. MetricCategoryTypeName Character. Type subgroup (e.g., "Sex", "Age group"). MetricCategoryName Character. Name subgroup (e.g., "Female", "18–39"). CategoryAttribute Character. Label used group individuals (e.g., "Male", "Persons"). AreaCode Character. ONS code NHS area (e.g., "U60176"). AreaID Integer. Internal ID NHS area. AreaName Character. Name NHS area (e.g., "3 Centres PCN"). Count Integer. Total number individuals subgroup. DataID Integer. Unique identifier data record. Denominator Numeric. Population count used denominator metric calculation. Factor Numeric. Scaling factor applied metric, applicable. Often NA. HighestPriorityNotificationType Character. Notification priority level, available. Often NA. LowerConfidenceLimit Numeric. Lower bound confidence interval metric value. Max Numeric. Maximum observed value metric across comparable areas. Median Numeric. Median value metric across comparable areas. Min Numeric. Minimum observed value metric across comparable areas. NotificationCount Integer. Count notifications associated indicator. Often zero. Numerator Numeric. Count used numerator metric calculation. Q20 Numeric. 20th percentile value across comparable areas. Q40 Numeric. 40th percentile value across comparable areas. Q60 Numeric. 60th percentile value across comparable areas. Q80 Numeric. 80th percentile value across comparable areas. TimePeriodID Integer. ID reporting time period. TimePeriodName Character. Label reporting time period (e.g., "March 2024"). UpperConfidenceLimit Numeric. Upper bound confidence interval metric value. Value Numeric. Calculated metric value (e.g., percentage patients treated). ValueNote Character. Additional notes flags value. Often NA.

text: Retrieves list tags CVDPREVENT API can used filter indicators. Tags provide way categorise search indicators clinical reporting groupings ("Priority Group", "Pathway Group" clinical categories). Use function obtain valid tag IDs use functions support filtering tag, cvd_indicator().

title: List all available indicator tags — cvd_indicator_tags
code: cvd_indicator_tags()

title: List all available indicator tags — cvd_indicator_tags
text: tibble one row per available indicator tag, containing following colunns: IndicatorTagID Integer. Unique identifier tag associated indicator. IndicatorTagName Character. Descriptive label categorising indicator (e.g., "monitoring", "prevention", "smoking"). tags found, returns tibble describing error.

title: List all available indicator tags — cvd_indicator_tags
text: Tags useful grouping filtering indicators dashboards, reports scripted analyses. Tag IDs returned function can supplied functions like cvd_indicator() via tag_id argument targeted queries.

text: function may take longer 5 seconds complete due API response time.

text: Returns tibble indicator type IDs corresponding names, used categorise CVD indicators CVDPREVENT API. function primarily helper cvd_time_period_list(), accepts indicator_type_id optional parameter.

code: cvd_indicator_types()

what: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list
title: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list
text: Retrieves available reporting periods CVDPREVENT API. Optionally, can filter periods specific indicator type (e.g., standard, outcome) using indicator_type_id parameter.

title: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list
code: cvd_time_period_list(indicator_type_id = NULL)

title: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list
text: indicator_type_id Optional integer. provided, restricts returned time periods containing data given indicator type.

title: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list
text: tibble containing details available time periods following columns: EndDate POSIXct. End date reporting period (e.g., "2025-06-30"). IndicatorTypeID Integer. Unique identifier indicator type (e.g., 1 = Standard, 2 = Outcomes). IndicatorTypeName Character. Descriptive name indicator type (e.g., "Standard", "Outcomes"). StartDate POSIXct. Start date reporting period. Typically set default baseline (e.g., "1900-01-01"). TimePeriodID Integer. Unique identifier time period. TimePeriodName Character. Display label time period (e.g., "June 2025", "Apr 2024 – Mar 2025"). data found, returns tibble describing error.

title: List available time periods for CVD indicators — cvd_time_period_list

what: List available time periods and associated system levels — cvd_time_period_system_levels
title: List available time periods and associated system levels — cvd_time_period_system_levels
text: Retrieves available reporting periods CVDPREVENT API, along NHS system levels included time period. function useful determine system levels (e.g., national, region, ICB, PCN, practice) data available reporting period.

title: List available time periods and associated system levels — cvd_time_period_system_levels
code: cvd_time_period_system_levels()

title: List available time periods and associated system levels — cvd_time_period_system_levels
text: tibble containing time periods corresponding system levels following columns: tibble following columns: EndDate POSIXct. End date reporting period (e.g., "2023-12-31"). StartDate POSIXct. Start date reporting period. Typically set default baseline (e.g., "1900-01-01"). TimePeriodID Integer. Unique identifier time period. TimePeriodName Character. Display label time period (e.g., "December 2023", "Apr 2022 – Mar 2023"). IsVisible Logical character. Indicates whether time period visible API dashboard ("Y" "N"). NationalLevel Logical character. Indicates whether data available national level ("Y" "N"). SystemLevelID Integer. Unique identifier system level (e.g., 1 = England, 4 = PCN). SystemLevelName Character. Name system level (e.g., "England", "Region", "Sub-ICB", "PCN"). data found, returns tibble describing error.

title: Version 0.2.3 (2025-11-05)
text: New function cvd_external_resource() retrieve metadata external resources linked CVDPREVENT, including category, source, type, tags. Support inequality marker breakdowns via cvd_indicator_person_timeseries() expanded documentation return structure. @return documentation blocks added major functions improve clarity usability.

title: Version 0.2.3 (2025-11-05)
text: Improved documentation across indicator-related functions, including clearer @description, @details, @seealso sections. Enhanced validation logic metric_id, area_id, time_period_id parameters ensure API compatibility. Refactored internal processing nested API responses better stability readability.

title: Version 0.2.3 (2025-11-05)
text: Corrected handling empty malformed API responses cvd_indicator_group() cvd_indicator_pathway_group(). Resolved issue system-level comparison functions failed relocate nested ComparisonData correctly.
